title: How to Hide Folders in Google Drive (on Mobile and Web Browser)

steps.title: Open Google Drive.
steps.content: Open Google Drive. This app icon looks like a red, green, blue, and yellow triangle. You can find it on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ next to the shared folder you want to make private.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ next to the shared folder you want to make private. You'll be able to tell which folder is shared if it has multiple profile icons in the lower right corner of the folder's thumbnail. [1] X Research source You can also tap the Shared tab at the bottom of your screen to filter the view to show you only folders and files that are shared with others.

steps.title: Tap Manage people and links.
steps.content: Tap Manage people and links . It's usually the second item in the menu if you have the necessary permissions (if you don't own the folder, you'll need to have Editor-level permissions to change the sharing settings).

steps.title: Tap the users that you want to hide the folder from.
steps.content: Tap the users that you want to hide the folder from. If your folder is shared with multiple people, you'll have to repeat this process with everyone.

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . It's next to an icon of an x and will remove that person from seeing your folder instantly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://drive.google.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://drive.google.com/ . Log in if prompted. You can use any web browser to change your sharing settings to hide folders in Google Drive.

steps.title: Double-click the shared folder you want to make private.
steps.content: Double-click the shared folder you want to make private. The folder will load in the same tab with a list of all the files. [3] X Research source You can also right-click the folder to get a menu without opening it.

steps.title: Click the multiple profile icons.
steps.content: Click the multiple profile icons. It's at the top of the folder next to "My Drive > FOLDERNAME >" and will open a sharing window. If you right-clicked earlier, click Share to see the same window.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu to the right of a name and click Remove.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu to the right of a name and click Remove . If the folder is shared with multiple people, you'll need to repeat this process for everyone. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This will close the window and save your changes. The people you removed from the folder will no longer be able to see it. [5] X Research source
